TITLE: 'NASA rules,' Musk says as SpaceX wins $2.9 billion moon lander contract
DESCRIPTION: NASA awarded billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk's space company SpaceX a $2.9 billion contract to build a spacecraft to bring astronauts to the moon as early as 2024, the agency said on Friday, picking it over Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin and defense contractor Dynetics Inc.

TITLE: Facebook oversight board extends timeline to decide on Trump ban
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc's (FB.O) independent oversight board said on Friday it had extended the timeline for deciding whether to uphold former U.S. President Donald Trump's indefinite suspension from Facebook and Instagram.

TITLE: U.S. China hawks seek to cut sales of chip-making tools to Beijing
DESCRIPTION: Congressional China hawks are urging the Biden administration to restrict sales of chip-making tools to Chinese companies, similar to an action taken against telecommunications equipment maker Huawei Technologies Co (HWT.UL).

TITLE: Massachusetts regulators seek to revoke Robinhood's license; brokerage sues
DESCRIPTION: Massachusetts regulators on Thursday sought the revocation of Robinhood's broker-dealer license after charging that it encourages inexperienced investors to place risky trades without limits, while the online brokerage sued to invalidate a new rule underlying the case.

TITLE: Dell spins off VMware stake, generating up to $9.7 bln to pay down debt
DESCRIPTION: Dell Technologies Inc (DELL.N) said on Wednesday it would spin off its 81% stake in cloud computing software maker VMware (VMW.N), in a move that will help the PC maker reduce its debt.

TITLE: U.S. hearing on China competition told research funding falling behind
DESCRIPTION: U.S. investment in research and development has reached its lowest level in decades while soaring in the rest of the world, the head of a U.S. Senate committee warned at a hearing on proposed subsidies to the tech industry to help the United States better compete with China.

TITLE: Coinbase boss Armstrong poised to reap fruits of listing
DESCRIPTION: As Coinbase Global Inc's (COIN.O) multi-billion dollar stock market listing accelerates cryptocurrency's leap to the top table of finance, its founder and CEO Brian Armstrong is poised to reap the benefits of the company's nine-year journey.

TITLE: Banking software firm Alkami valued at more than $3 bln in U.S. market debut
DESCRIPTION: Shares of Alkami Technology Inc (ALKT.O) surged 38% in their U.S. stock market debut on Wednesday, giving the U.S. banking software provider a market capitalization of $3.43 billion.

TITLE: Uber expects employees to return to office by Sept. 13
DESCRIPTION: Uber Technologies Inc (UBER.N) said on Wednesday it expects its employees to return to office by Sept. 13, making it one of the first major U.S. tech companies to set a return date.

TITLE: Instagram launches test where users can choose to see likes
DESCRIPTION: Instagram is launching a small global test on Wednesday where users can choose whether to hide like counts on their own posts or other people's posts, a Facebook spokeswoman said.

TITLE: Ireland launches inquiry into Facebook after reports of data leak
DESCRIPTION: Ireland's Data Protection Commission (DPC) said on Wednesday it had launched an inquiry into Facebook Inc (FB.O), after a dataset reported to contain personal data relating to some 533 million Facebook users worldwide was made public.

TITLE: Coinbase valued at $86 bln in choppy Nasdaq debut
DESCRIPTION: Coinbase Global Inc (COIN.O) was valued at $86 billion at the end of its Nasdaq debut on Wednesday, in a choppy day of trading when its valuation went as high as $112 billion.

TITLE: Russian watchdog opens case against Yandex over alleged competition law breach
DESCRIPTION: Russia's Federal Antimonopoly Service (FAS) on Tuesday said it had initiated proceedings against internet giant Yandex (YNDX.O) over alleged competition law violations on the company's search engine.

TITLE: Deployment of EU electric vehicle charging stations too slow, auditors say
DESCRIPTION: The European Union's deployment of charging infrastructure for electric vehicles is not quick enough to meet the bloc's targets, EU auditors said on Tuesday.

TITLE: U.S. senator wants to ban Big Tech from buying anything ever again
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Senator Josh Hawley, a Republican who has been a staunch critic of Big Tech, said on Monday he has introduced a bill that would ban all mergers and acquisitions by any company with a market value greater $100 billion, a category that includes the five biggest U.S. tech companies.

TITLE: Nvidia, Volvo Cars accelerate auto industry's data-processing power race
DESCRIPTION: Volvo Cars said Monday it will use a new generation of high-powered chips from Nvidia Corp (NVDA.O) to enable more autonomous driving functions in future vehicles, starting next year.

TITLE: Nvidia expects first-quarter sales to exceed $5.3 bln
DESCRIPTION: Nvidia Corp's (NVDA.O) first-quarter revenue will be above its earlier forecast of $5.3 billion, the chipmaker said on Monday, as it benefits from strong demand for chips that power data centers and cryptocurrency mining.

TITLE: Intel in talks to produce chips for automakers within six to nine months -CEO
DESCRIPTION: The chief executive of Intel Corp (INTC.O) told Reuters on Monday the company is in talks to start producing chips for car makers to alleviate a shortage that has idled automotive factories.

TITLE: Nvidia to directly challenge Intel with Arm-based 'Grace' server chip
DESCRIPTION: Nvidia Corp (NVDA.O) on Monday said it plans to make a server processor chip based on technology from the United Kingdom's Arm Ltd, putting it in the most direct competition yet with rival Intel Corp (INTC.O) and adding a layer of complexity to the antitrust review of Nvidia's $40 billion deal to buy Arm.

TITLE: White House says does not expect decision to come from chip shortage meeting
DESCRIPTION: A White House meeting on Monday about a semiconductor chip shortage is not expected to immediately lead to a decision or announcement about what to do about the shortages, White House spokeswoman Jen Psaki said on Monday.

TITLE: Twitter to open first Africa office to tap fast-growing market
DESCRIPTION: Twitter Inc (TWTR.N) will open its first African office in Ghana, it said on Monday, as the social media company seeks to make inroads in some of the world's fastest-growing markets.

TITLE: Samsung SDI to supply battery cells to EV startup Rivian
DESCRIPTION: Electric vehicle startup Rivian, backed by Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O) and Ford Motor Co (F.N), said on Monday that South Korean manufacturer Samsung SDI Co Limited (006400.KS) would supply battery cells for its vehicles.

TITLE: U.S. senators criticize Apple for not testifying on antitrust concerns
DESCRIPTION: Apple Inc (AAPL.O) is refusing to testify at an upcoming U.S. Senate subcommittee hearing on competition issues related to mobile app stores, the bipartisan leaders of the panel said on Friday.

TITLE: Elon Musk's Neuralink shows monkey with brain-chip playing videogame by thinking
DESCRIPTION: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk's brain-chip startup released footage on Friday appearing to show a monkey playing a simple videogame after getting implants of the new technology.

TITLE: Analysis: Amazon's win in union fight shows harsh realities facing labor movement
DESCRIPTION: Amazon.com Inc's (AMZN.O) fierce resistance to unionization, skepticism among workers that organizing could get them a better deal and decisions on election parameters all contributed to the apparently lopsided defeat of a labor drive at the company's warehouse in Bessemer, Alabama, people close to the events said.

TITLE: Spain to subsidise electric car sales with 800 million euros to 2023
DESCRIPTION: The Spanish government has approved a plan to spend up to 800 million euros ($950 million) until 2023 to encourage electric car sales, the Energy Ministry said on Friday.

TITLE: Crypto traders on Robinhood jump six-fold to 9.5 million in Q1
DESCRIPTION: Online brokerage Robinhood said on Thursday that 9.5 million users traded cryptocurrency on its platform during the first quarter of 2021, a near six-fold rise from the previous quarter.

TITLE: Google-backed TAE Technologies raises $280 million from new, existing investors
DESCRIPTION: (Corrects to remove inaccurate company descriptor from headline. Also corrects paragraph 3 to say that the company plans to use the funds for further work related to nuclear fusion)

TITLE: LSE-backed investment platform PrimaryBid targets France, U.S. market entry: CEO
DESCRIPTION: British retail investment platform PrimaryBid plans to expand to France and the United States later this year after facilitating Deliveroo's "community" share offer last week, its chief executive and co-founder told Reuters.

TITLE: Naspers investors want big deals, share buyback after Tencent windfall
DESCRIPTION: Investors in Naspers Ltd - Africa's biggest company - said on Thursday they want proceeds from a $14.7 billion stake sale in its Tencent Holdings investment to go towards blockbuster acquisitions or a share buyback.

TITLE: Factbox: Russian central bank considers digital rouble in 2023
DESCRIPTION: (Refiles to remove superfluous word in headline; no change in text.)

TITLE: Instacart, DoorDash plan to launch credit cards: WSJ
DESCRIPTION: U.S. grocery delivery app Instacart Inc and food delivery firm DoorDash Inc are planning to launch their own credit cards, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

TITLE: Facebook does not plan to notify half-billion users affected by data leak
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc did not notify the more than 530 million users whose details were obtained through the misuse of a feature before 2019 and recently made public in a database, and does not currently have plans to do so, a company spokesman said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Twitch will ban users for 'severe misconduct' that occurs away from its site
DESCRIPTION: Live-streaming service Twitch will ban users for offenses such as hate-group membership or credible threats of mass violence that occur entirely away from the site, in a new approach to moderating the platform, the company said on Wednesday.

TITLE: U.S. scours files for more Trump-era migrant family separations than previously known
DESCRIPTION: The Biden administration said on Wednesday it is examining 5,600 previously unreviewed cases of migrant children to see whether they were separated from parents at the U.S.-Mexico border under former President Donald Trump.

TITLE: Russian lawmaker floats idea of Zoom ban if it halts sales to state institutions
DESCRIPTION: A lawmaker from Russia's ruling party floated the idea of banning Zoom on Wednesday after the video conferencing company reportedly told its distributors to stop selling subscriptions to Russian state institutions.

TITLE: Self-driving sensor startup Innoviz's shares rise on public debut
DESCRIPTION: Shares of self-driving car sensor startup Innoviz rose on Tuesday, on its first day trading as public company.

TITLE: Software firm Canva valued at $15 billion after latest investment
DESCRIPTION: Australian software firm Canva on Tuesday said the company's valuation had more than doubled to $15 billion following an investment of $71 million.

TITLE: Google AI scientist Bengio resigns after colleagues' firings: email
DESCRIPTION: Google research manager Samy Bengio said on Tuesday he was resigning, according to an internal email seen by Reuters, in a blow to the Alphabet Inc unit after the firings of his colleagues who questioned paper review and diversity practices.

TITLE: YouTube discloses prevalence of rule-breaking videos for first time
DESCRIPTION: About 1.6 million views on YouTube out of every 1 billion are of a video that violates its content policies, about even with a year ago, the streaming service owned by Alphabet Inc's Google said in a new disclosure on Tuesday.

TITLE: Intel aims for supply chain edge with new data center chip
DESCRIPTION: Intel Corp on Tuesday introduced its newest flagship data center microprocessor, hoping its in-house manufacturing operations will help it navigate a chip shortage to better compete against rival Advanced Micro Devices Inc's (AMD) faster chips.

TITLE: EU institutions experienced hack attempt in March: spokesman
DESCRIPTION: The European Commission and other EU institutions were the target of a cyber attack last month, but there has been no evidence so far of any major information breach, a Commission spokesman said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Cryptocurrency firm Paxos to apply for clearing agency license
DESCRIPTION: Cryptocurrency firm Paxos said on Tuesday it will apply for a formal clearing agency license from the U.S. Securities regulator following a pilot test in which Credit Suisse and Instinet used its platform for same-day trade settlements.

TITLE: Intel CEO to attend White House meeting on chip supply chain
DESCRIPTION: Intel Corp Chief Executive Officer Pat Gelsinger will virtually attend a meeting being put together by President Joe Biden's administration for April 12 to discuss the semiconductor supply chain issues disrupting U.S. automotive factories, according to a person familiar...

TITLE: LG's smartphone exit: who stands to gain?
DESCRIPTION: LG Electronics' move to exit its loss-making mobile business is expected to create more opportunities for Samsung than its other rivals in the lucrative North American smartphone market, analysts said.

TITLE: Crypto market cap surges to record $2 trillion, bitcoin at $1.1 trillion
DESCRIPTION: The cryptocurrency market capitalization hit an all-time peak of $2 trillion on Monday, according to data and market trackers CoinGecko and Blockfolio, as gains over the last several months attracted demand from both institutional and retail investors.

TITLE: Coinbase gets all-clear from SEC, setting stage for landmark crypto listing
DESCRIPTION: Coinbase Global Inc, the largest U.S. cryptocurrency exchange, has received approval from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to list its shares on the Nasdaq, paving the way for what will be a landmark victory for cryptocurrency advocates.

TITLE: Workday appoints new board Chairman after David Duffield resigns
DESCRIPTION: Workday Inc said on Thursday David Duffield has resigned as the Chairman of the board and the company has appointed its co-chief executive officer and board member Aneel Bhusri as his replacement.

TITLE: Eastern Caribbean blazes a trail as first currency union to launch central bank digital cash
DESCRIPTION: The Eastern Caribbean on Thursday became the first currency union central bank to issue digital cash, a move that comes as bigger monetary authorities such as the European Central Bank look at issuing their own electronic cash.

TITLE: Micron outlook beats expectations as memory chip prices rise
DESCRIPTION: Micron Technology Inc on Wednesday forecast fiscal third-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates due to a rise in demand for memory chips thanks to 5G smartphones and artificial intelligence software that is pushing memory chip prices upward.

TITLE: Analysis: Deliveroo's flop a wake-up call for tech hopefuls
DESCRIPTION: A dismal London stock market debut for Deliveroo, coming on the heels of other lukewarm listings, may be a sign that investors are becoming more discerning when it comes to buying shares in companies that have yet to turn a profit.

TITLE: Facebook removes video of Trump interview with daughter-in-law Lara, citing ban
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc has removed a video of an interview with former U.S. President Donald Trump, who remains banned from the platform, from his daughter-in-law Lara Trump's Facebook page, a company spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Robinhood to scrap confetti animation on app after 'gamification' criticism
DESCRIPTION: Robinhood Markets Inc will discard its signature confetti animation that used to mark first trades for users on its trading app, following criticism from politicians and regulators.

TITLE: Ransomware tops U.S. cyber priorities, Homeland secretary says
DESCRIPTION: Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas said on Wednesday that dealing with ransomware will be a top priority, highlighting the growing threat of the data-scrambling software.

TITLE: ByteDance says it is 'bleeding' due to India bank account freeze, no relief from court
DESCRIPTION: An Indian court on Wednesday granted no relief to China's ByteDance, owner of the TikTok video app, in a case where the company challenged the local tax authority's decision to block its Indian bank accounts, dealing a blow to its operations.

TITLE: U.S., Central Asian countries agree to focus on digital trade issues
DESCRIPTION: Senior trade officials from the United States met on Tuesday with their counterparts from Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyz Republic, Tajikistan, and Turkmenistan on a range of trade issues, underscoring their desire to strengthen trade ties among countries in the region, and...

TITLE: Arm Ltd debuts new chip technology aimed at overtaking data centers
DESCRIPTION: Arm Ltd, the British technology firm whose chip technology powers most of the world's smartphones, on Tuesday released a new generation of technology aimed at taking over data centers and artificial intelligence applications ahead of its planned $40 billion merger with Nvidia...

TITLE: Coinbase names ex-SEC director Brett Redfearn as head of Capital Markets
DESCRIPTION: U.S. cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase Global Inc on Tuesday named Brett Redfearn, a former director of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), as vice president of capital markets division ahead of its planned stock market listing.

TITLE: Poland's CD Projekt to seek M&A targets in bid to become a top gamemaker
DESCRIPTION: Poland's CD Projekt will seek merger and acquisition targets in its bid to become one of the top three video game makers in the world, it said in its awaited strategy update on Tuesday.

TITLE: Poland's CD Projekt releases patch for Cyberpunk 2077
DESCRIPTION: Poland's CD Projekt has released a patch for its Cyberpunk 2077 game, the video games maker said on Monday, potentially paving a way for the game to return to the PlayStation store after its removal last year.

TITLE: EU antitrust watchdogs to have more say over tech, pharma, biotech start-up deals
DESCRIPTION: EU antitrust regulators are set to have more say over small merger deals involving start-ups in the technology, biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries, the EU enforcer said on Friday, in a warning to big companies eyeing such deals.

TITLE: GameStop swings between gains and losses, capping volatile week
DESCRIPTION: Meme stock-in-chief GameStop swung between gains and losses on Friday, with the shares reversing course after rising 19% earlier in the session.

TITLE: Watch out for Russia and China, UK's cyber security boss says
DESCRIPTION: Russia poses the most acute immediate threat to the United Kingdom in cyberspace while China's ambition to be dominant in a host of new technologies will transform the 21st Century world we live in, the head of Britain's cyber security centre said.

TITLE: India says video streaming platforms should be held responsible for content
DESCRIPTION: India's technology minister on Thursday said video streaming services have to be "responsible and accountable" for their shows and movies, defending rules introduced last month that regulate such content.

TITLE: GameStop up 13% more as 'Reddit army' bets on sales turnaround
DESCRIPTION: Meme stock-in-chief GameStop jumped another 13% in value on Friday, building on a surge since results earlier this week that showed online sales improving and a much-hyped management reshuffle gathering pace.

TITLE: Baby boomers next to jump into crypto, Galaxy Digital's Novogratz predicts
DESCRIPTION: Wealthy baby boomers will be the next generation to jump into cryptocurrencies as they become more mainstream, potentially bringing billions of dollars to the rallying sector, said Mike Novogratz, founder of crypto firm Galaxy Digital.

TITLE: Chinese hackers used Facebook to target Uighurs abroad, company says
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it had blocked a group of hackers in China who used the platform to target Uighurs living abroad with links to malware that would infect their devices and enable surveillance.

TITLE: Sweden's MTG to buy New Zealand-based Ninja Kiwi for up to $186 million
DESCRIPTION: E-sports and gaming group MTG has agreed to buy mobile games developer Ninja Kiwi for around 1.6 billion crowns ($186 million) to broaden its gaming portfolio, it said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Australian lidar firm Baraja raises $31 million in funding
DESCRIPTION: Australian lidar firm Baraja said on Wednesday it had raised $31 million in a new funding round from investors including Blackbird Ventures and Hitachi Construction Machinery.

TITLE: IKEA invests in mapping technology startup what3words
DESCRIPTION: Ingka Group, the owner of most IKEA stores, has bought a 12 million pound ($16 million) stake in what3words, the London-based technology startup that has divided the world into three metre squares to help pinpoint locations.

TITLE: Trustpilot shares drop below IPO price a day after market debut
DESCRIPTION: Shares in online reviews platform Trustpilot dropped 4.7% to 252.6 pence on Wednesday, falling below its IPO price one day after making its stock market debut in London.

TITLE: Facebook, Google CEOs suggest ways to reform key internet law
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg laid out steps to reform a key internet law on Wednesday, saying that companies should have immunity from liability only if they follow best practices for removing damaging material from their platforms.

TITLE: Disney delays 'Black Widow' debut, adds streaming option in summer movie shuffle
DESCRIPTION: Walt Disney Co on Tuesday delayed the worldwide release of Marvel Studios film "Black Widow" by two months until July and said it would offer the movie simultaneously in theaters and for a fee on the Disney+ streaming service.

TITLE: IPO contender UiPath extends automation offering with Cloud Elements buy
DESCRIPTION: UiPath, the $35 billion robotic process automation startup tipped as a contender to float on the stock market, said on Tuesday it had acquired U.S. interconnectivity specialist Cloud Elements.

TITLE: Apple card, underwriter Goldman Sachs committed no fair lending violations
DESCRIPTION: New York's Department of Financial Services on Tuesday said it concluded its investigation of Apple's <AAPL.O> credit card and its underwriter Goldman Sachs Group Inc and found no evidence of unlawful discrimination against applicants under the state's fair lending law.

TITLE: Microsoft to allow more employees at its headquarters from March 29
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Corp said on Monday it would start allowing more employees to work from its headquarters in Redmond, Washington and nearby campuses from March 29.

TITLE: Top Democrat speaks to Biden staff about key internet law
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Senator Mark Warner said on Monday he has been talking to President Joe Biden's staff about Section 230 - a law protecting tech companies - and expects his recent legislation to reform the law to find a Republican co-sponsor.

TITLE: SkyBridge's Scaramucci files to launch bitcoin ETF with First Trust Advisors
DESCRIPTION: Former White House communications director Anthony Scaramucci has jumped into the fray for a bitcoin exchange-traded fund with his SkyBridge Capital joining forces with First Trust Advisors, according to a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

TITLE: Infineon sees quarterly revenue hit from Texas outage
DESCRIPTION: German chipmaker Infineon said on Friday it expected a quarterly hit to revenues in the high double-digit million euro range from a production outage at its U.S. plant in Austin, Texas caused by last month's snowstorm.

TITLE: Facebook services restored after global outage
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc has fixed a technical issue that caused a global outage of its services after more than a million people reported problems with its photo-sharing app Instagram.

TITLE: NFT-related stocks gyrate wildly as digital asset buzz grows
DESCRIPTION: The popularity of non-fungible tokens (NFT), a type of digital asset that is authenticated by blockchain, is spreading to equities as investors turn their focus to shares of online art trading platforms and companies making NFT-related announcements, sparking outsize swings...

TITLE: Facebook developing wristband to support augmented reality glasses
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it is developing a wristband that would be able to control its augmented reality (AR) glasses that are expected to be launched this year.

TITLE: Robinhood appoints former Google executive as first chief product officer
DESCRIPTION: Robinhood Markets Inc has appointed former Google executive Aparna Chennapragada as its first chief product officer, a blog post by the U.S. online brokerage showed on Wednesday.

TITLE: U.S. subpoenas Chinese communications firms in probe of national security risks
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. Commerce Department said on Wednesday that it has served subpoenas on multiple Chinese companies that provide information and communications technology services in the United States to see if they pose a national security risk.

TITLE: Explainer: NFTs are hot. So what are they?
DESCRIPTION: Non-fungible tokens (NFTs), a type of digital asset, have exploded in popularity this year, with NFT artworks selling for millions of dollars and musicians such as the Kings of Leon rock group embracing them for their latest album.

TITLE: China chipmaker SMIC to invest in $2.35 billion facilities in Shenzhen
DESCRIPTION: Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp (SMIC) said on Wednesday it planned to jointly invest in a $2.35 billion project with the government of Shenzhen to make 40,000 wafers per month in the southern Chinese city from 2022.

TITLE: Facebook starts to remove recommendations for political and social groups globally
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it is starting to remove the recommendations it gives global users for political and social issue Facebook groups, a move it has billed as turning down tension on the site.

TITLE: Lenovo's parent invests $237 million in Chinese chipmaker Fullhan
DESCRIPTION: Legend Holdings, the parent of the world's biggest PC maker Lenovo, said it would buy a 15.9% stake in chipmaker Fullhan Microelectronics for 1.54 billion yuan ($236.9 million) in a push to diversify its portfolio.

TITLE: Israel's Incredibuild raises $140 million in Insight-led funding round
DESCRIPTION: Israel's Incredibuild, which helps companies speed up their software development process, said on Wednesday it had raised $140 million in a private funding round led by U.S. venture capital and private equity firm Insight Partners.

TITLE: White House task force met to discuss Microsoft software weaknesses
DESCRIPTION: The White House's task force looking into the recent hack of Microsoft Corp's Exchange met this week with representatives of the private sector, White House spokeswoman Jen Psaki said in a statement on Wednesday

TITLE: Cryptocurrency inflows hit record high of $4.2 billion, CoinShares says
DESCRIPTION: Inflows into cryptocurrency funds and products have already hit a record $4.2 billion for the first quarter, reflecting growing institutional investor interest, CoinShares data showed.

TITLE: Microsoft hack fallout substantial for Dutch servers, watchdog says
DESCRIPTION: Dutch authorities on Tuesday said that the fallout for the Netherlands from a hack on Microsoft CorpÃ¢ÂÂs Exchange was substantial, with at least 1,200 Dutch servers likely to have been affected.

TITLE: Microsoft hack fallout substantial for Dutch servers, watchdog says
DESCRIPTION: Dutch authorities on Tuesday said that the fallout for the Netherlands from a hack on Microsoft CorpÂ¡Â¯s Exchange was substantial, with at least 1,200 Dutch servers likely to have been affected.

TITLE: Lizhi shares soar as Citron expects stock to nearly triple
DESCRIPTION: Shares of Lizhi Inc rose as much as 45% on Tuesday, as short-seller Citron Research set a price target of $30 for the Chinese audio mobile app developer.

TITLE: Google to cut app store fee by half on developers' first $1 million in sales
DESCRIPTION: Alphabet Inc's Google will cut the service fee it charges developers on its app store by half on the first $1 million they earn in revenue in a year, after a similar move by rival Apple Inc last year.

TITLE: Zalando's outlook for 2021 revenue growth above market expectations
DESCRIPTION: German online fashion retailer Zalando said on Monday its revenue expectations for 2021 were significantly above market projections, following a strong start to the year.

TITLE: Women crowd-source their own security on Tel Aviv's streets
DESCRIPTION: The 2011 party in central Israel turned grim when a woman was cornered by two men in a side-room. Then her girlfriends, worried about her absence, turned up. The assailants fled.

TITLE: AMD launches 'Milan' chip for data centers as battle with Intel intensifies
DESCRIPTION: Advanced Micro Devices Inc on Monday released a new data center chip aimed at taking away more market share from rival Intel Corp.

TITLE: Crypto investor 'Metakovan' named as buyer of $70 million digital artwork
DESCRIPTION: The buyer of a $70 million digital-only artwork was named on Friday by auction house Christie's as a crypto asset investor who goes by the pseudonym "Metakovan."

TITLE: U.S. government to respond to SolarWinds hackers in weeks: senior official
DESCRIPTION: The Biden administration will respond "in weeks, not months" to the perpetrators of the SolarWinds hack, who used the U.S. tech company as a springboard to compromise a raft of U.S. government agencies, a senior administration official said on Friday.

TITLE: Factbox: What are NFTs and who's cashing in on them?
DESCRIPTION: NFTs are all the buzz this year, with people raking in millions by auctioning these digital assets.

TITLE: Timeline: Events leading up to Ant Group CEO Hu's departure
DESCRIPTION: Ant Group's CEO Simon Hu unexpectedly resigned on Friday in the midst of the financial technology group's regulatory-driven revamp after its scuttled initial public offering.

TITLE: U.S.-China meeting to touch on Hong Kong, technology concerns: Sullivan
DESCRIPTION: U.S. officials will raise concerns about Chinese actions on Hong Kong and security risks involving technology when they meet with Beijing's top diplomats next week, President Joe Biden's national security adviser Jake Sullivan told reporters.

TITLE: White House national security adviser will identify actor behind Microsoft hack in near future
DESCRIPTION: President Joe Biden's national security adviser, Jake Sullivan, said on Friday the Biden administration is still gathering information on the scale of the hack on Microsoft Corp's exchange.

TITLE: Cryptocurrency platform FalconX secures $50 million investment
DESCRIPTION: Cryptocurrency trading platform FalconX said on Thursday it had secured a $50 million investment from Tiger Global and B Capital Group.

TITLE: Cars' adaptive cruise control raises crash risks, U.S. study finds
DESCRIPTION: Adaptive cruise control systems on cars, which control braking and speed, raise the risk of traffic crashes because the technology leads drivers to go faster, a U.S. study found on Thursday.

TITLE: Snowflake CEO Slootman joins Instacart board
DESCRIPTION: Instacart said on Thursday cloud-based data warehouse firm Snowflake's chief executive officer, Frank Slootman, has joined the board of the U.S. grocery delivery company that is preparing to go public this year.

TITLE: Language-learning app Babbel targets 1 billion Frankfurt IPO: sources
DESCRIPTION: Lesson Nine, the company behind language-learning app Babbel, is preparing to list on the Frankfurt stock in a deal expected to value it at more than 1 billion euros ($1.19 billion), people close to the matter said.

TITLE: Pakistan blocks social media app TikTok over indecency complaint
DESCRIPTION: Pakistan on Thursday blocked the popular social media app TikTok after a court order over a complaint that it ran indecent content, a spokesman for the country's telecoms regulator said.

TITLE: Smartphone maker Xiaomi to buy back shares up to $1.3 billion
DESCRIPTION: China's smartphone maker Xiaomi Corp said on Thursday it will buy back shares up to HK$10 billion ($1.29 billion) on the open market under a repurchase program, even as its stock price continues to slump.

TITLE: Greensill tech partner Taulia secures $6 billion funding from JPM-led consortium
DESCRIPTION: U.S. fintech firm Taulia, a technology partner of supply chain finance specialist Greensill, said on Wednesday it had secured more than $6 billion in funding from a financing consortium led by JPMorgan.

TITLE: Goldman Sachs customers' demand for bitcoin rising: COO
DESCRIPTION: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. is exploring how it can meet rising customer demand to own and invest in bitcoin, while still staying on the right side of regulation, bank President and Chief Operating Officer John Waldron said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Up to 60,000 computer systems exposed in Germany to Microsoft flaw: BSI
DESCRIPTION: As many as 60,000 computer systems in Germany were exposed to a flaw that allows unauthorized users to access systems in Microsoft Corp's email software, the head of its cybersecurity watchdog said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Truckmaker Scania says semi-conductor shortage threaten production: Dagens Industri
DESCRIPTION: Truckmaker Scania, part of Volkswagen AG's commercial vehicle arm Traton SE, might have to stop production as a shortage of semi-conductors threatens deliveries, Swedish media quoted it as saying on Wednesday.

TITLE: At least 10 hacking groups using Microsoft software flaw: researchers
DESCRIPTION: At least 10 different hacking groups are using recently discovered flaws in Microsoft Corp's mail server software to break in to targets around the world, cybersecurity company ESET said in a blog post on Wednesday.

TITLE: Norway's parliament hit by new hack attack
DESCRIPTION: Hackers have infiltrated the Norwegian Parliament's computer systems and extracted data, officials said on Wednesday, just six months after a previous cyber attack was made public.

TITLE: Facebook's lawyers blast attorney fees bid in deal over 2018 data breach
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc is pushing back on plaintiffs lawyers' request for nearly $12 million in fees and costs for securing an injunctive relief-only settlement stemming from a 2018 cyberattack that affected millions of Facebook users.

TITLE: Twitter's Dorsey to convert proceeds from auction of first ever tweet to bitcoin
DESCRIPTION: Twitter Inc boss Jack Dorsey said on Tuesday he will convert proceeds from the digital auction of the first ever tweet on the platform to bitcoin for charity.

TITLE: U.S. lawmakers ask Facebook for details on advertising practices
DESCRIPTION: A group of 23 U.S. House Democrats on Monday asked Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg for answers on the social media site's advertising practices over targeted ads for gun accessories and protective equipment.

TITLE: European banking regulator EBA targeted in Microsoft hacking
DESCRIPTION: The European Banking Authority on Monday said it had been targeted by hackers, although no data had been obtained and it was redoubling efforts to shield itself amid a global cyber attack exploiting flaws in Microsoft's mail server software.

TITLE: PayPal to buy Israeli digital asset security provider Curv
DESCRIPTION: PayPal Holdings Inc said on Monday it would buy Israel-based digital asset security provider Curv, as the payments processor looks to strengthen support to cryptocurrencies.

TITLE: White House says hackers exploiting Microsoft flaw are an active threat
DESCRIPTION: The White House says that the hackers exploiting the recently disclosed flaw in Microsoft's Exchange email software are an ongoing problem.

TITLE: Hackers target Williams F1 livery launch on AR app
DESCRIPTION: Hackers prevented the Williams Formula One team from giving fans a first glimpse of their car's new livery via an augmented reality app on Friday.

TITLE: More than 20,000 U.S. organizations compromised through Microsoft flaw
DESCRIPTION: More than 20,000 U.S. organizations have been compromised through a back door installed via recently patched flaws in Microsoft Corp's email software, a person familiar with the U.S. government's response said on Friday.

TITLE: Antivirus software pioneer McAfee charged by U.S. with cryptocurrency fraud
DESCRIPTION: John McAfee, the antivirus software pioneer whose former company still bears his name, has been indicted on fraud and money-laundering conspiracy charges stemming from two cryptocurrency schemes, the U.S. Justice Department said on Friday.

TITLE: Twitter explores 'undo send' feature for paying users
DESCRIPTION: Twitter Inc is testing an "undo send" function that would give users a short time to withdraw a tweet before it is posted, the company confirmed on Friday.

TITLE: YouTube will lift ban on Trump channel when risk of violence decreases: CEO
DESCRIPTION: Alphabet Inc's YouTube will lift its suspension on former U.S. President Donald Trump's channel when it determines the risk of real-world violence has decreased, the company's CEO, Susan Wojcicki, said on Thursday.

TITLE: U.S. Senate mulls $30 billion in funding to boost chipmaking sector, source says
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. Senate is considering including in a new bill to boost competitiveness against China $30 billion in funding for previously-approved measures to supercharge the country's chipmaking industry, a congressional source said on Thursday.

TITLE: Moderna, IBM team up on COVID-19 vaccine distribution data
DESCRIPTION: Vaccine maker Moderna Inc and IBM Corp said on Thursday they would work together on technologies to track COVID-19 vaccine administration.

TITLE: SAP CEO's 2020 pay package was 9.2 million euros: annual report
DESCRIPTION: SAP Chief Executive Christian Klein's fixed and variable pay jumped 67% to 9.2 million euros ($11.1 million) last year, under German disclosure rules, although he took home less after a tough year for the business software group.

TITLE: Exclusive: Apple faces EU charges over Spotify complaint - sources
DESCRIPTION: Apple could face an EU antitrust charge sheet in the coming weeks after a complaint by rival Spotify that it unfairly pushed its own music streaming service, two people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

TITLE: Explainer: Honda unveils its new level 3 technology, but how does it work?
DESCRIPTION: Honda Motor Co Ltd unveiled on Thursday a limited batch of its flagship Legend sedan this week, becoming the world's first carmaker to sell a vehicle equipped with certified level 3 self-driving technology.

TITLE: Biden's election will not undo Trump interference in Huawei extradition case, lawyers say
DESCRIPTION: Lawyers for Huawei's chief financial officer said on Wednesday that Joe Biden's election as U.S. president will not undo the political interference in her case, which they say stems from former President Donald Trump's pledge to intervene if it helped the United States extract...

TITLE: XL Fleet shares tumble after Muddy Waters takes short position
DESCRIPTION: Shares of XL Fleet Corp, which provides electric drive systems to enhance vehicle fuel economy, fell as much at 19.5% on Wednesday after U.S. short-selling firm Muddy Waters said it has taken a short position in the company's stock.

TITLE: Activist investor ValueAct builds 5.2% stake in Germany's Stroeer
DESCRIPTION: U.S. activist investor ValueAct has built a stake of 5.2% in Stroeer, the German digital and outdoor advertiser said on Wednesday, following negative publicity around stock loans taken out by the company's top investor.

TITLE: Facebook to end ban on political ads in United States
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc will lift its temporary ban on political advertising in the United States on Thursday, the company said in a blog post on Wednesday.

TITLE: Factbox: Mortgage dealers hop on Reddit-fueled short squeeze bandwagon
DESCRIPTION: Mortgage dealers UWM Holdings Corp and Rocket Companies are the latest stocks to be targeted in a short squeeze trading storm.

TITLE: 'Roaring Kitty' in GameStop saga testifies before Massachusetts regulators
DESCRIPTION: The social media persona "Roaring Kitty," whose online posts helped spark January's trading frenzy in GameStop Corp shares, appeared before Massachusetts securities regulators on Wednesday to testify as part of an examination into his activities.

TITLE: EU watchdog urges tighter rules to prevent another Wirecard scandal
DESCRIPTION: European Union rules on company financial information need to be updated to apply the lessons of the collapse of German payments firm Wirecard, the bloc's securities watchdog said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Intel loses U.S. patent trial, ordered to pay $2.18 billion to VLSI Tech
DESCRIPTION: Chipmaker Intel Corp must pay a technology rival $2.18 billion after a federal jury decided that Intel infringed on its patent, a federal court ruled on Tuesday.

TITLE: U.S. ITC to probe some cellular devices made by Samsung, Motorola Mobility
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. International Trade Commission on Tuesday said it was probing certain LTE-compliant cellular devices made by Samsung Electronics Co Ltd and Lenovo Group Ltd-owned Motorola Mobility following a complaint.

TITLE: EU recovery funds for telcom networks must help competition - Vestager
DESCRIPTION: European Union countries presenting plans to speed-up rollout of high-speed telecoms network should comply with rules aimed at protecting competition, the EU Antitrust head said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Robotics division of Uber's Postmates spins out into new company
DESCRIPTION: The robotics unit of Postmates, a delivery startup that ride-hailing firm Uber Technologies acquired last year, has spun off into a new company called Serve Robotics, the company said on Tuesday.

TITLE: U.S. hedge fund Farallon accuses Toshiba of 'backpedaling' on strategy
DESCRIPTION: Farallon Capital Management on Tuesday accused Toshiba Corp on Tuesday of "backpedaling" over its investment strategy, a charge the Japanese firm has dismissed.

TITLE: Instacart valuation more than doubles to $39 billion with latest funding round
DESCRIPTION: Instacart has more than doubled its valuation in less than six months to $39 billion with a $265 million fundraising round from existing investors, as the grocery delivery company benefits from a surge in online orders during the COVID-19 pandemic.

TITLE: Israel offers incoming travelers alternative to quarantine hotel: tracking bracelet
DESCRIPTION: Israelis returning home from abroad have a new option that will exempt them from being sent to a quarantine hotel: They can wear a bracelet monitor that will notify authorities should they violate a mandatory isolation period.

TITLE: U.S. panel recommends export 'choke points' to prevent Chinese dominance in semiconductors
DESCRIPTION: A U.S. national security commission on Monday recommended Congress tighten up "choke points" on chipmaking technology to prevent China from overtaking the United States in semiconductors in the coming years.

TITLE: Apple's 270 U.S. stores all open for first time since pandemic began
DESCRIPTION: Apple said on Monday all its 270 U.S. stores have been opened, the first time in almost a year after it was forced to shutter several outlets because of the COVID-19 pandemic.

TITLE: Marvell to supply chips for Facebook-backed 5G effort
DESCRIPTION: Marvell Technology Group Ltd said on Monday its chips will be included in a project from Facebook Inc designed to make it easier and cheaper to deploy 5G networking equipment.

TITLE: U.S. regulators probe Robinhood over trading curbs
DESCRIPTION: Retail brokerage Robinhood said on Friday U.S. regulators were looking into its temporary trading curbs on so-called meme stocks earlier this year as shares of companies like GameStop Corp soared during a social media-fueled short-squeeze.

TITLE: Short-sellers take aim at Chinese blockchain firm SOS, shares tumble
DESCRIPTION: Short-sellers Hindenburg Research and Culper Research said on Friday they have taken a short position on Chinese blockchain firm SOS Ltd's stock, sending the company's shares down 23%.

TITLE: Poland's CD Projekt delays results due to cyber attack
DESCRIPTION: Polish video games maker CD Projekt posptoned the publication of its financial results for 2020 and the first quarter of 2021 as a result of a cyber attack that resulted in restricted access to its systems, the company said on Friday.

TITLE: Nigeria needs to regulate cryptocurrencies, not ban them: vice president
DESCRIPTION: Nigeria's central bank and securities regulator need to find ways to regulate cryptocurrencies rather than prohibiting their use, Vice President Yemi Osinbajo said on Friday, urging them to come up with a regime that would support growth and innovation.

TITLE: Google judge tells lawyers to figure out document dispute
DESCRIPTION: A federal judge hearing a U.S. government antitrust case against Google on Thursday urged the lawyers to work out a complicated dispute on pre-trial document production among themselves.

TITLE: ASM sees higher first quarter revenue on the back of strong orders
DESCRIPTION: Dutch semiconductor manufacturing equipment supplier ASM International expects a rise in first-quarter revenue after fourth-quarter orders beat expectations, it said on Thursday.

TITLE: From left-for-dead to the next 'hot brand', short seller changes view on GameStop
DESCRIPTION: The battle for videogame retailer GameStopÃ¢ÂÂs future took a new twist on Thursday when a prominent investor suggested that the company, which has been at the center of a recent stock trading frenzy, should buy online gambling firm Esports Entertainment Group.

TITLE: Microsoft facing issues with Teams livestreaming
DESCRIPTION: (Reporting by Tiyashi Datta in Bengaluru; Editing by Aditya Soni)

TITLE: U.S. Postal chief commits to 10% of new delivery fleet as electric vehicles
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Postmaster General Louis DeJoy told lawmakers on Wednesday the Postal Service was committed to having electric vehicles make up 10% of its next-generation fleet as part of its multibillion-dollar plan to retire its 30-year-old delivery vehicles.

TITLE: Poland's CD Projekt delays Cyberpunk 2077 fix due to cyber attack
DESCRIPTION: Polish video games maker CD Projekt is delaying the release of a patch for its Cyberpunk 2077 game until the second half of March, it said on Wednesday, after a cyber attack slowed down work on fixes for the troubled game.

TITLE: Facebook's oversight board has received appeal from 'user' in Trump ban case
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc's oversight board has received a "user statement" for the case it is deciding about whether the social media company was right to indefinitely suspend former President Donald Trump's Facebook and Instagram accounts, a board spokeswoman confirmed on Tuesday.

TITLE: LinkedIn says tech issue on platform resolved
DESCRIPTION: LinkedIn, Microsoft Corp's professional networking site, said on Tuesday it had resolved a technical glitch on its platform, after thousands of users reported difficulties in accessing the website.

TITLE: Snap expects ad platform to drive annual sales growth of over 50% for many years
DESCRIPTION: Snap Inc's self-serve advertising platform can drive multiple years of over 50% annual revenue growth, its product chief said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Apple plans to increase dividend, approves executive compensation - CNBC
DESCRIPTION: Apple Inc is planning to increase dividend according to Chief Executive Tim Cook, CNBC reported on Tuesday, citing the shareholder meeting.

TITLE: Twitter removes hundreds of accounts it says are linked to Iran, Russia, Armenia
DESCRIPTION: Twitter said on Tuesday it had taken down 373 accounts which it said had ties to Russia, Armenia and Iran and had breached its platform manipulation policies.

TITLE: Exclusive: Starboard eyes cloud software firm Box board challenge - sources
DESCRIPTION: Hedge fund Starboard Value LP is preparing to launch a board challenge against Box Inc unless the U.S. cloud services provider takes steps to boost value for shareholders, according to people familiar with the matter.

TITLE: U.S. bank software provider Alkami plans IPO at $3 billion valuation - sources
DESCRIPTION: Alkami Technology has chosen Goldman Sachs Group Inc to lead preparations for a planned initial public offering of the U.S. banking software provider later this year that may value it at $3 billion, people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

TITLE: U.S. House committees to hold Feb 26 hearing on 'SolarWinds' hack
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. House of Representatives' Oversight and Homeland Security Committees will hold a joint hearing on Friday on cybersecurity incidents including the attack targeting SolarWinds Orion Software, it said in a statement.

TITLE: Broker IG pulls some of its riskier products after GameStop frenzy
DESCRIPTION: London-listed trading platform IG said on Monday it would withdraw a number of its riskier equities products after a frenzy of stock market bets by small U.S. investors earlier this year triggered huge swings in some share prices.

TITLE: Google to resume accepting political ads in U.S.
DESCRIPTION: Alphabet Inc's Google will resume accepting political advertisements in the United States from Feb. 24, according to an email to advertisers seen by Reuters.

TITLE: Silicon Labs explores breakup, sale of analog chip unit - Bloomberg News
DESCRIPTION: Silicon Laboratories Inc is considering a potential breakup and exploring the sale of its analog chip unit, Bloomberg News reported on Friday.

TITLE: U.S. settles with BitPay for apparent sanctions breaches
DESCRIPTION: BitPay, one of the biggest cryptocurrency payment processors, will pay $507,375 to settle its potential civil liability for apparent violations of U.S. sanctions on countries like Cuba, North Korea and Iran, the U.S. Treasury Department said.

TITLE: U.S. Senate panel to hold Feb 23 hearing on 'SolarWinds' hack
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. Senate intelligence committee will hold a hearing next week on the recent hack against the United States with executives from SolarWinds, Microsoft, FireEye and CrowdStrike, it said in a statement on Thursday.

TITLE: Reddit says all systems operational following tech glitch
DESCRIPTION: Reddit said on Thursday all of its systems were operational after it fixed a technical glitch that was causing a high rate of errors on the social media platform.

TITLE: Google adds Apple's TV app to latest Chromecast device
DESCRIPTION: Alphabet Inc's Google has added Apple Inc's TV app, which includes paid streaming service Apple TV+, to the latest Chromecast TV device, the search giant said on Thursday.

TITLE: Biden to order review of U.S. reliance on overseas supply chains for semiconductors, rare earths - CNBC
DESCRIPTION: U.S. President Joe Biden will direct his administration to conduct a review of key U.S. supply chains including semiconductors, high-capacity batteries, medical supplies and rare earth metals, CNBC reported https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/18/biden-to-order-supply-chain-review-to-assess-us-reliance-on-overseas-semiconductors.html...

TITLE: After blizzard of criticism over Mexico trip, Senator Ted Cruz flies back to frozen Texas
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Senator Ted Cruz flew into a storm of criticism on Thursday after leaving his home state of Texas in the grip of a deadly deep freeze, for a family holiday jaunt to the Mexican resort of Cancun he said he took to please his young daughters.

TITLE: Robinhood begins delivering tax forms to customers after missing deadline
DESCRIPTION: Online brokerage app Robinhood Markets said it has started delivering tax forms and expects most customers to receive them by late Wednesday, after it missed an earlier deadline.

TITLE: White House cyber adviser says it will take months to investigate Russian hack
DESCRIPTION: The White House's top cybersecurity adviser said on Wednesday an investigation into a sprawling Russian hacking operation against the United States, known as the SolarWinds hack, will take several more months to complete.

TITLE: Mobile ad companies form alliance to prepare for Apple privacy changes
DESCRIPTION: Six mobile advertising companies said Wednesday they have formed a partnership to help marketers and app developers adjust to upcoming Apple Inc changes that will affect how advertising works on iPhones.

TITLE: Capgemini upbeat on profit outlook as work-from-home boosts cloud services
DESCRIPTION: Capgemini on Wednesday said profitability would beat market expectations in 2021, after the group reported full-year results in line with consensus, boosted by growth in its digital and cloud services.

TITLE: Microsoft says Teams app technical issue mostly resolved
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Corp said it had mostly resolved the technical issue that delayed message delivery on its widely used Teams workplace messaging app earlier on Wednesday.

TITLE: Blackrock has started to dabble in bitcoin: Rick Rieder on CNBC
DESCRIPTION: BlackRock CIO of global fixed income Rick Rieder told CNBC on Wednesday that the world's largest asset manager has started to "dabble a bit" in bitcoin.

TITLE: Crypto wallet Blockchain.com raises $120 million in latest funding round
DESCRIPTION: Blockchain.com, a provider of cryptocurrency services, has raised about $120 million in its latest funding round, which included investments from Alphabet Inc's venture capital unit, GV, the company said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Israeli chipmaker Tower to invest extra $150 million to boost capacity
DESCRIPTION: Tower Semiconductor plans to invest an extra $150 million to boost production, the Israeli chipmaker said on Wednesday, as it forecast record revenues this year amid growing demand.

TITLE: French IT monitoring firm Centreon says no customers affected by hacking campaign
DESCRIPTION: French IT monitoring company Centreon said on Tuesday that none of its customers were affected by a hacking campaign described by the country's cybersecurity agency in a recent report.

TITLE: Lithuanian police investigate leak of 110,000 personal IDs
DESCRIPTION: Lithuanian police are investigating the leak of personal data of 110 thousand people, including five government ministers and the capital city's mayor, they said on Tuesday, after the list was placed on a hacker website.

TITLE: Permira selling 12 million shares in Germany's TeamViewer, says bookrunner
DESCRIPTION: Private equity investor Permira is selling 12 million shares in German software company TeamViewer through an accelerated bookbuilt offering, the bookrunner on the deal said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Spotify to allow employees to work from anywhere
DESCRIPTION: Spotify Technology SA will allow its employees to work from anywhere, the Swedish music streaming company said in a blog post https://newsroom.spotify.com/2021-02-12/distributed-first-is-the-future-of-work-at-spotify on Friday, further upending the future of modern working...

TITLE: Car chip shortages a sign of wider demand crunch: ASML executive
DESCRIPTION: (This February 11 story amends reference to targets in penultimate paragraph)

TITLE: Face control: Russian police go digital against protesters
DESCRIPTION: Georgy Malets didn't make it to an anti-Kremlin rally last month. He was detained on his way there by police using facial recognition technology in the Moscow metro.

TITLE: Loeb's Third Point praises Intel, avoids crowded short positions
DESCRIPTION: Billionaire investor Daniel Loeb called Intel's resources "unmatched" in the semiconductor industry and said his firm, Third Point, is "excited" to be a long-term investor.

TITLE: Facebook building Clubhouse-like audio chat product: New York Times
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc is building a new audio chat product similar to audio-based social network Clubhouse, the New York Times reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

TITLE: Toyota to unveil two new EVs for U.S. market that will go on sale in 2022
DESCRIPTION: Toyota Motor Corp said on Wednesday it will unveil two new electric vehicles that will go on sale next year in the United States amid a growing push by the Biden administration to cut vehicle emissions, sending the Japanese automaker's shares soaring.

TITLE: Ubisoft sees top-line growth in 2021-2022 after record third quarter
DESCRIPTION: Ubisoft expects its top-line to grow in the 2021-2022 fiscal year, the French video game maker said on Tuesday, citing a big slate of major new releases, a big step in the free-to-play model and a strong back catalogue of games.

TITLE: Toyota, Denso team with Aurora on self-driving cars for Uber, others
DESCRIPTION: Toyota Motor Corp and longtime supplier partner Denso Corp will team up with self-driving car startup Aurora to develop and build autonomous minivans for ride hailing networks, the companies said on Tuesday.

TITLE: (OFFICIAL)-Electric scooter maker Niu in talks to supply Gojek - CEO
DESCRIPTION: Niu Technologies is in talks to supply its electric scooters to Southeast Asian ride-hailing company Gojek to increase market share in the region, the electric scooter maker's CEO told Reuters.

TITLE: Myanmar military rulers order block on Twitter, Instagram 'until further notice'
DESCRIPTION: The new military rulers of Myanmar on Friday ordered mobile operators and internet service providers to block access to Twitter and Instagram in the country until further notice, Norwegian telecom Telenor said.

TITLE: Numbers of GameStop shares shorted dips further -- S3 Partners
DESCRIPTION: The number of GameStop shares being shorted continued to decline modestly, according to the latest data from analytics firm S3 Partners, as the stock fueled by retail traders fell sharply in price.

TITLE: Facebook faces a reckoning in Myanmar after blocked by military
DESCRIPTION: The Myanmar military's shutdown of Facebook access following the ouster of the democratically elected Aung San Suu Kyi caps years of tension between the social media company and the most powerful institution in a nation where Facebook is used by half the population.

TITLE: Number of GameStop shares shorted edges higher: S3 Partners
DESCRIPTION: The number of GameStop shares shorted edged higher as the video game retailer's stock price tumbled on Tuesday, according to the latest data from analytics firm S3 Partners.

TITLE: Game on after GameStop: Stocks soar again despite amber warnings
DESCRIPTION: When the man in the street starts dispensing stock market tips, it's time for the professionals to exit, goes the saying.

TITLE: Germany predicts chip investments of up to 50 billion euros in Europe
DESCRIPTION: European countries are planning to support the local production of technology hardware with targeted aid that could result in overall investments of up to 50 billion euros ($60 billion), Germany said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Volkswagen plans to challenge Google with own autonomous car software
DESCRIPTION: Volkswagen plans to develop most of the software needed for autonomous cars in-house, the head of the German carmaker's luxury unit Audi said on Tuesday.

TITLE: 'Papa Musk' tweets raise cheer in wrong Clubhouse
DESCRIPTION: When Elon Musk says something, something moves somewhere on a market. Just not always what you might expect.

TITLE: All eyes on Alphabet's first-ever disclosure of Google Cloud profit
DESCRIPTION: Alphabet Inc will report the cost and operating profit of its Google Cloud business for the first time on Tuesday, disclosures that are expected to overshadow record overall quarterly sales for the internet's biggest platform for ads.

TITLE: Game reboots key to future growth as EA seen posting record revenue
DESCRIPTION: Wall Street analysts expect Electronic Arts Inc to report record quarterly revenue on Tuesday, as gamers stuck at home due to fresh pandemic-induced restrictions boost demand for its sports titles "Madden NFL 21" and "FIFA 21" in the crucial holiday shopping season.

TITLE: Number of GameStop shares shorted falls by over half in week -S3 Partners
DESCRIPTION: The number of GameStop shares that were shorted fell by over half in a week as short sellers covered their bets, analytics firm S3 Partners said on Monday, although the video game retailer remained a highly shorted stock.

TITLE: Apple's Tim Cook criticizes social media practices, intensifying Facebook conflict
DESCRIPTION: Apple Inc Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook on Thursday criticized polarization and misinformation on social media, intensifying a conflict between the iPhone maker and Facebook Inc.

TITLE: Factbox: Here's what Facebook's oversight board says the company should do
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc's independent oversight board made its first binding decisions on Thursday, overruling the company's actions in four of the five cases it reviewed. https://www.oversightboard.com/news/165523235084273-announcing-the-oversight-board-s-first-case-decisions

TITLE: Baidu gets California nod for testing empty self-driving cars
DESCRIPTION: Baidu Inc has received a permit from the state of California to test self-driving cars without a driver behind the wheel, the state's Department of Motor Vehicles said on Wednesday.

TITLE: BlackRock may have raked in $2.4 billion on GameStop's retail-driven stock frenzy
DESCRIPTION: BlackRock Inc, the world's largest asset manager, could have made gains of about $2.4 billion on its investment in GameStop Corp as retail investors pour money into the video-game retailer's shares.

TITLE: Timeline: GameStop's 1,600% surge in retail investor vs hedge fund battle
DESCRIPTION: Shares of GameStop surged as much as 1,600% between Jan. 11 and Wednesday after an unprecedented stock market battle pitting amateur investors piling on the videogame retailer's shares against hedge funds scrambling to cover losing bets.

TITLE: Nokia not aware of any reason for share surge
DESCRIPTION: Finnish technology firm Nokia said on Wednesday it was not aware of any reason for the continuing surge in its share price.

TITLE: SAP, promising transformation, kicks off cloud computing push
DESCRIPTION: Christian Klein, CEO of German software group SAP, on Wednesday launched a campaign to encourage customers to move operations to the cloud, a shift that has brought short-term pain to investors but one that he hopes will pay off over time.

TITLE: No let up in short squeeze, retail frenzy forces funds to cover
DESCRIPTION: Shares of GameStop and AMC Entertainment Holdings each more than doubled on Wednesday, forcing hedge funds to take heavy losses as they unloaded short positions, sparking calls for scrutiny of anonymous stock market trading posts on social media.

TITLE: Google opens Dublin hub to tackle harmful online content
DESCRIPTION: Alphabet unit Google on Wednesday opened a centre to tackle harmful online content, in a move also designed to ease regulatory concerns about how the company and other tech giants police a growing problem on the internet.

TITLE: Google to stop using Apple tool to track iPhone users, avoiding new pop-up warning
DESCRIPTION: Google's iPhone apps such as Maps and YouTube will stop using a tool from Apple Inc that allows them to personalize ads, avoiding a new Apple warning that informs users their browsing is being tracked.

TITLE: Twitter grants academics full access to public data, but not for suspended accounts
DESCRIPTION: Twitter Inc on Tuesday opened free access to its new application programming interface (API) software for academic researchers, enabling them to study public conversations on its platform, but is not providing data from suspended accounts as part of the product.

TITLE: Retail trading frenzy sparks jitters for noted GameStop short-seller
DESCRIPTION: Short-seller Andrew Left does not usually smoke. But on Monday he had a cigarette to calm his nerves as shares of GameStop Corp, the stock he had shorted, continued to rocket higher.

TITLE: Chip industry group urges Biden admin to review export controls on China
DESCRIPTION: A semiconductor industry group on Monday called for a review of the Trump administration's export control policy, and urged the incoming U.S. Commerce Secretary to work with allies when curbing sales of U.S. technology to China for national security.

TITLE: Facebook to provide data on targeted political ads to researchers
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc said on Monday it would provide academic researchers information on how political ads were targeted in the lead-up to the presidential election in the United States last year.

TITLE: Roivant Sciences founder to step down as CEO
DESCRIPTION: The founder of Roivant Sciences will step down from the role of chief executive officer, the SoftBank-backed biotechnology company said on Monday.

TITLE: Twitter suspends account of Iranian Supreme Leader after apparent Trump threat
DESCRIPTION: Twitter suspended an account linked to Iran's Supreme Leader on Friday, hours after it carried the image of a golfer resembling former President Donald Trump apparently being targeted by a drone alongside a vow to avenge the killing of a top Iranian general in a U.S. drone...

TITLE: U.S. panel asks FBI to review role of Parler in Jan. 6 Capitol attack
DESCRIPTION: The House Oversight and Reform Committee on Thursday asked the FBI to investigate the role Parler, a social media website and app popular with the American far right, played a role in the violence at the U.S. Capitol.

TITLE: Facebook hands decision on Trump ban to oversight board
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it was referring its decision to indefinitely suspend the accounts of former U.S. President Donald Trump to its independent oversight board.

TITLE: Investors pump $125 million into EV charging startup Volta
DESCRIPTION: Volta, a San Francisco-based electric vehicle charging startup, said on Tuesday it had raised $125 million from investors.

TITLE: Logitech says company can grow after COVID-19 boom
DESCRIPTION: Logitech International will grow in a post-coronavirus world, Chief Executive Bracken Darrell said on Tuesday, as the rise in home working and playing during the pandemic pushed the computer peripherals maker to its best-ever quarterly results.

TITLE: Logitech CEO wants to stay as long as he can at company
DESCRIPTION: Logitech International Chief Executive Bracken Darrell's recent sale of $4.2 million of stock was due to the upcoming expiry of share options and should not be taken as any pessimism about the computer peripherals maker's future, he said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Biden names geneticist Lander for new Cabinet-level post, elevating role of science
DESCRIPTION: U.S. President-elect Joe Biden named pioneering geneticist Eric Lander as the director of the Office of Science and Technology Policy on Friday, elevating the post to Cabinet-level status for first time.

TITLE: Messaging app Signal facing technical difficulties
DESCRIPTION: Signal said on Friday it was experiencing technical difficulties and working to restore the service, as it dealt with a flood of new users after rival messaging app WhatsApp announced a controversial change in privacy terms.

TITLE: Italian data authority takes aim at Whatsapp's privacy disclaimer
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc-owned messenger WhatsApp did not clearly communicate to users changes to its privacy policy, potentially making it difficult for people to decide whether to drop the service, Italy's data protection authority said on Thursday.

TITLE: Trump administration issues interim rule on secure technology transactions
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. Commerce Department on Thursday issued interim rules aimed at the securing the nation's communication and technology supply chain that would prohibit certain transactions with Russia, China, Iran, Venezuela, North Korea and Cuba.

TITLE: ThoughtWorks raises $720 million from Siemens, GIC, other investors
DESCRIPTION: Software consultancy company ThoughtWorks said on Thursday it raised $720 million from investors including GIC and Siemens AG at an enterprise value of $4.6 billion.

TITLE: Trump administration shelves planned investment ban on Alibaba, Tencent, Baidu: sources
DESCRIPTION: The Trump administration has scrapped plans to blacklist Chinese tech giants Alibaba, Tencent and Baidu, four people familiar with the matter said, providing a brief reprieve to Beijing's top corporates amid a broader crackdown by Washington.

TITLE: Google to pause U.S. political ads ahead of presidential inauguration
DESCRIPTION: Alphabet Inc's Google will stop selling political ads referencing U.S. elections across its services until at least Jan. 21, following last week's violence at the Capitol, according to an email to advertisers seen by Reuters.

TITLE: Biden says huge data breach poses 'grave risk' to U.S., promises response
DESCRIPTION: U.S. President-elect Joe Biden said on Tuesday that a widespread data breach of the government apparently carried out by the Russian government poses a "grave risk" to national security that cannot "go unanswered."

TITLE: U.S. has evidence hackers accessed its nuclear networksÃÂ -Politico
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. Energy Department and National Nuclear Security Administration, which manages the country's nuclear weapons stockpile, have evidence that hackers gained access to their networks as part of a massive cyber campaign, Politico reported on Thursday, citing officials...

TITLE: Facebook to lift post-election political ad pause in Georgia
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc on Tuesday said it would lift a temporary post-election ban on political ads in Georgia beginning on Wednesday, as the U.S. state prepares for runoff elections next month that will determine which party controls the Senate.

TITLE: Fired U.S. cyber chief sues Trump campaign, lawyer over threats
DESCRIPTION: The former head of the U.S. government's cybersecurity agency sued Donald Trump's campaign and one of the president's lawyers on Tuesday for defamation after the lawyer suggested in a television interview he should be shot.

TITLE: Twitter labels Trump tweet about 'surprise ballot dumps' as possibly disputed and misleading
DESCRIPTION: Twitter Inc <TWTR.N> on Wednesday flagged a post by President Donald Trump which said "surprise ballot dumps" were being found in hotly contested states during the presidential election as disputed and possibly misleading.
